page.title: 20THE NEW A38 PARKWAY
page.content: FEATURED IN THE 1943{"PLAN FOR {PLYMOUTH"}THIS NEW ROAD CONSTRUCTION WAS COMPLETED ON 1/4/1985.IT COSTÂ£34m FEATURING A{THREE LEVEL INTERCHANGE AT {MANADON.}FORDER VALLEY MARSH NEEDED 12800 DRAINS.ROUTE{LENGTH TOTALS 2.5 {MILES.}TRAFFIC FLOW MAINTAINED AT ALL TIMES.EXCAVATIONS FOR CUTTINGS TOTALLED 1.24m CUBIC METRES.LARGE SCALE DIVERSIONS OF PUBLIC SERVICES NECESSARY,ESPECIALLY AT MANADON. CHILDREN OF MANADON,WIDEY AND AUSTIN FARM SCHOOLS PRESENT AT OPENING,SOME ACTUALLY OPENED THE PEDESTRIAN WALKWAYS AT MANADON INTERCHANGE.{ {CONGESTION PROBLEMS}ARE NOW OCCURRING AT{MARSH MILLS}ROUNDABOUT WHERE A FLYOVER HAS BEEN REQUESTED.SIMILARLY CONGESTION WILL BE EXPERIENCED AT THE{ {TAMAR ROAD BRIDGE}UNTIL{SALTASH}IS BY- PASSED.
